title: Chicago Cubs Nuveen Ad font
content:
Hi everyone.

I'm trying to find the fonts used in the Nuveen ad campaign for the Chicago Cubs. I have been trying to find the sans serif caps font and brush script. I think I have identified the brush script as LaSalle EF but I have had no luck with the other font.

Any help or suggestions would be much appreciated.

Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425084857im_/http:/typophile.com/files/nuveen6_3419.jpg)
author: schmoopy.design

comments.content:
Sorry the picture is so big and you have to scroll to the right.

Here's the link.

[http://adsoftheworld.com/media/outdoor/nuveen\_investments\_chicago\_cubs\_6](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425084857/http:/adsoftheworld.com/media/outdoor/nuveen_investments_chicago_cubs_6 "http://adsoftheworld.com/media/outdoor/nuveen\_investments\_chicago\_cubs\_6")

No idea about the font but ...

<cite>Sorry the picture is so big and you have to scroll to the right.</cite>

I solemnly declare myself puzzled about why so often here people in the design business are obviously unable to cut out and/or resize the relevant part of a graphic image.

Thanks for the constructive criticism. For the record I tried several times to crop and resize the image but every time it wouldn't load and would only accept this version.

Thanks for your huge help though.

Testing.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425084857im_/http:/typophile.com/files/nuveen_4301.jpg)

Has a similar style to [Bank Gothic AS](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425084857/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/alphabetsoup/bank-gothic-as/?testdrive=dock%3Dfalse%26size%3D186%26w%3D600%26src%3Dcustom%26text%3DCUBS%2520IS%2520YET%26fg%3D000000%26bg%3Dffffff%26goodies%3Dfit%252Cot.liga%26seed%3D35) but not exact.

Chicago basketball team name Chicago Cubs start his next season from 2014. The cubs tickets are available of all season at [http://www.ticketdove.com/chicago-cubs-tickets.aspx](http://web.archive.org/web/20150425084857/http:/www.ticketdove.com/chicago-cubs-tickets.aspx "http://www.ticketdove.com/chicago-cubs-tickets.aspx")

Well this is very interesting indeed.Would love to read a little more of this. Great post.
